item.title: Ben & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield resigns over dispute with owner Unilever
item.description: Greenfield said the Vermont ice cream maker "has been silenced, sidelined for fear of upsetting those in power" by Unilever, the multinational corporation that bought Ben & Jerry's in 2000.

item.title: Trump moves to scrub national parks sites of signs that cast America in a "negative light"
item.description: The National Park Service faced a deadline this week to address signs that "inappropriately disparage" historical figures. One target is George Washington's house in Philadelphia, where he held enslaved people.

item.title: Vitamin B3 can help protect against skin cancer. Here's who may benefit
item.description: Dermatologists often recommend nicotinamide — a form of Vitamin B3 — following skin cancer. A study of nearly 34,000 veterans finds this supplement reduces the risk of skin cancer recurrence.

item.title: Russia gives Ukrainian kids military training and reeducation, Yale researchers find
item.description: The Yale Humanitarian Research Lab says Russia's network of sites for Ukrainian children is larger than previously thought, and programs includes military training for children as young as 8.

item.title: The Justice Department sues Maine and Oregon, ratcheting up demands for voter data
item.description: The Department of Justice is escalating its demands for sensitive data from voting officials, suing two Democratic-controlled states who have thus far rebuffed the department's requests.

item.title: How Charlie Kirk became a leader of the conservative youth movement
item.description: New York Times reporter Robert Draper explains Kirk's rise and legacy. He was killed Sept. 10. Draper also discusses conservative commentator Nick Fuentes, a rival of Kirk's with a large following.
